[tab]I think I got one you’ll like.[l][r][tab]Few months back, me and buncha other blokes went out on a raid. This puny li’l village. [l]They didn’t do much trade, just livin’ off what they could grow, so no one figured we’d make out with much. [l]Grab a little grub, plough some o’ the girls, that was the best anyone was hopin’ for.[l][r][r][tab]Business as usual—we killed the guys, had some fun with the girls, then killed them too. [l]Nothin’ too interestin’, nothin’ real excitin’ up t’ that point.[l][r][r][tab]But that changed when I busted into this one house.[p]
*scenarioFD_B9C4EAC2_DF5D_49BA_81E2_7BCD8438C57D|

[tab]There’s a man, a woman, and a little girl mebbe five years old. [l]No siblings, just the girl. Easy as snappin’ a baby’s neck.[p]

[tab]That left the kid. [l]Wasn’t like she could do nothin’, so I didn’t [i]have[/i] to kill her, but y’know how the stupid things get, cryin’ like it’s the end o’ the bloody world. [l]So I figure, I’ll run her through before she starts howlin’ on me, right?[l][r][r][tab]But get this.[l][r][tab]The kid smiled at me and said, [l]“Where are you from, Mister?”[p]

[tab]’Bout a month after we picked the girl up, we had a bit o’ trouble. [l]There’s this chubby bloke by the name o’ Marcos, and he starts gettin’ this thing for her, yeah? [l]I ain’t one to get on a guy about what gets his rocks off, but a five-year-old girl? [l]That just ain’t right.[p]

[tab]We purchased her when she was about five years old, so she’s been with us for quite some time. [l]Eight, maybe nine years now.[l][r][r][tab]When we bought her, she was still too young to put to work. [l]She was in good health, though, and always had the sweetest smile on her face, so I had little doubt she would do as she was told.[p]
*scenarioFD_BA4F4079_4F5E_4295_8383_D7AB669EE05F|
[cm][resetfont]
[hr]
[tab]Slaves tend to be so gloomy and depressing, you know? [l]Not that I don’t understand, but unlike many, we try not to mistreat our slaves. [l]As long as they do their work, they have nothing to worry about.[l][r][tab]The best slaves, I think, are the ones who aren’t so dreary as to be infectious and make us feel guilty.[p]
*scenarioFD_436F58BB_F279_49DD_8B57_0933483EE689|
[cm][resetfont]
[hr]
[tab]The girl’s name was Ceren, and while she talked rather funny, she was as bright and cheerful as I had hoped. [l]And she was always, always smiling from ear to ear.[l][r][r][tab]For a while, it felt like we had a brand new member of our family. [l]I was so taken with her I almost considered adopting her instead of keeping her as a slave.[p]
*scenarioFD_E9220797_7114_4BD7_97CF_8501746F31C2|
[cm][resetfont]
[hr]
[tab]And how did I go from wanting to take her in to not caring if she didn’t come back?[l][r][tab]It’s rather difficult to explain, to tell you the truth.[l][r][tab]Yes, that’s right. She never caused any trouble. [l]She never stole anything, and she never refused to work. [l]She never cried, and she never got upset. *scenarioFD_AE8D2065_50B3_4B80_B4D3_DBF82B361EEE|

[tab]That sounds like the ideal slave? Yes, you would think so. [l]And I have no complaints regarding her work. [l]Neither did my husband, nor our servants.[l][r][tab]I imagine I’m the only one who would be happy to never see her again...[p]

*scenarioFD_339538A9_95EF_44B5_B7A2_EB3C9437D903|

[hr]
[tab]So as I said, he had to be punished.[l][r][tab]My husband took a length of rope and used it as a, um, a whip, I think it’s called? [l]He had all the slaves watch as he lashed the one that had tried to run.[l][r][tab]It was for their own sake. The other slaves needed to see what would happen if they attempted to flee.[p]
*scenarioFD_0439661C_2739_485A_B306_5007EE8916DE|
[cm][resetfont]

[tab]There’s a city about ten days by carriage from here—you know the one, right at Lord Barnier’s doorstep.[l][r][tab]The place I used to work was there, and every so often, the lord would summon a few of the prettiest girls to come to his manor.
